text: are you running on port 3000 by chance?  If so change it to something else (3001, 8080)

Hi team)
The functionality of our extension is growing fast, and its UI is growing. Now we see that in the near future we could split our UIE and extract logic and UI into the additional separate UIE cards (the plan is to have 3 separate cards). Our ideal vision is that customers could install our current app from the marketplace and then, during the tab view setup, select the card that they need to display.
So my question is, could we do this or not?

We are interested in adding the Sentry to our extension. But now I’m working on another part of our product.
So could you share any type of documentation? I’ll take a look and will be back with the decision about whether that is covering our needs or not. If your solution covers our case, we will implement it and share the feedback with the HubSpot team)
<@U04HWGVKYM7> do you have any update on this issue because it is impacting the users and it has been more than 24hours this issue happened and still no update.
and why these kind of issues are not reported on HubSpot status page. <https://status.HubSpot.com/>
<@U03FJQPSC0Y> can you help on above issue.
I‘ve never tried but when it’s working the same as private Apps this should work.
There is a fix in progress. It should be out soon
Sorry for the disruption in your workflow.
Of course. Could you send me your email address? I'll share a doc with you.
done. sent direct to you

Update: The `DescriptionList` issue has been fixed and the `direction= row` should now be rendering properly:+1:   We are very sorry about the inconvenience and thank you for your patience. Let us know if any issues persist.

Hi team!
I have a question regarding the property updates and the recent "Undo" feature.
Our forms rely heavily on the `CrmPropertyList` component and `onCrmPropertyUpdate` to trigger state changes and validations (enabling save buttons, for example).
We used to receive instant feedback from the component when a file was added or removed from file properties.
The addition of the undo button is creating a delay and the user is often trying to save and close the panel before the property is updated (while they would still be able to undo).

Do you have any suggestions? Thanks!

Also interested if anyone has comments on this, as i have a similar problem with panels and CrmPropertyList (updating of a property seems to take longer now, and users close the panel due to the speed in which it used to work...)

<@U05KNCMAE7N> <@U01NMMDTERZ> do you know if there's a feedback from the crmPropertyList component about the state of the property update?

This change is breaking our panels and forms at the moment. Users are reporting errors and we can't address them without adding several workarounds.

<@U01GW2U4WMA>

When the extension is not running, here are the ports in use.

tcp46   0   0 *.15611        *.*          LISTEN

When the extension starts up, the following are in use

tcp46   0   0 *.5173         *.*          LISTEN
tcp46   0   0 *.5174         *.*          LISTEN
tcp46   0   0 *.8080         *.*          LISTEN
tcp46   0   0 *.15611        *.*          LISTEN

Actually - I must have been tired last night.

I forgot to run npm install in the app.functions directory - it's working now.

I see I couldn't remember the port they use on the HS side - 8080 - not 3000 - if you're localhost is set to use port 8080 it will conflict with the HS dev server which also uses that port - glad you got it fixed

We're seeing the same behavior on our end. This happens because the property doesn't actually change until the 'undo' action disappears. The extensibility team is working with the CRM team to find a way to improve the experience. I apologize for the disruption

Yes, maybe I didn't make it clear, but we understood that the property wasn't being changed until the undo button was not available anymore. We understand the cause, but we would like to address it by "listening" to the state of this property change.

Please let me know if there's anything we can do in the meantime to help. Thanks
